entry.title: Free Joule Base! What does it mean for SAP's resellers?
entry.content:
Over the last months SAP has made several announcements related to making Joule free for customers.  In this article I will review the current status and share my thoughts on this topic and the opportunities for SAP channel partners.

My take on SAP making Joule Base free:   There are real costs involved for SAP to run Joule Base for customer.  When users query Joule SAP leverages LLMs to deal with the quiry and this has costs for SAP.  SAP does not pass this on to users.   But obviously, businesses don’t give away anything for free without a reason.  In my opinion, SAP has showed commitment to its statement that Joule will be the new UI of SAP solutions.  This is a strategic move for the future.    The core value and “crown jewel” of SAP is its automation of business processes, not the UI.  Making it easy and simple for customers to consume these core capabilities will make SAP’s core solutions more consumed and successful.  And that is where the important revenue streams for SAP are.

Joule is becoming more and more a platform.  Sometimes Joule is even called the AI OS of SAP.  Further, Joule and Joule agents also have the potential to leverage AI to integrate all the SAP solutions as needed, on the fly.  For many years people have said that  SAP solutions could be better integrated.  Perhaps Joule and Joule Agents will be a big step forward in this area?

Joule is becoming so central for SAP offerings and solutions that it makes sense to democratize it. 

What exactly do customers get for free?

Customers get “Joule Base” for free.  In my opinion, this is pretty much the “classic” Joule we heard about when SAP launched Joule last year.   Till now, Joule was available for some LOB solutions, but with limitation on how many free “Joule requests” a user was granted. And initially, transactional pattern was not included in the free Joule Base launched at Sapphire this year. However, transactional pattern is now included and there is no limit to the free requests / usage by the user.

With Joule Base users can leverage three types of activities (called Joule patterns): 

  • Navigational: ask a question in your own words related to what you want to do in the system and Joule will analyze your question together with LLMs and propose the best SAP app / screen for you to leverage.   Is these capabilities valuable for a user?  If a user always does the same activities and is an expert in the system, this might have limited value.  But if a user complain that SAP is difficult to work with this can absolutely help.  Also, for new users and existing users needing to do something new in the system the capabilities (together with informational pattern) can be very useful.  Finally, an interesting perspective from a channel partner always positioning Joule to customers and prospects: with the new generation of people joining the workforce, tools like Joule will become more and more important.  The new generation of workers expect to be able to get help from the systems they are supposed to use and master, instead of learning everything upfront.
  • Informational:  user can ask a question about how the SAP system works and Joule will leverage SAP help portal and the LLMs to provide an answer: the relevant sections from the help portal will be collected, passed on to the LLM with the appropriate prompt, and the LLM will make a summary for the specific question of the user.   For example, “what is the difference between a service order and a service contract”.   Other examples can be questions about how certain accounting principles works in SAP.   Further, a very interesting opportunity for customers is to extend this capability with information about their own work instructions, policies etc as part of document grounding.  In my opinion, the costing of SAP document grounding is very appealing for smaller customers.
  • Transactional:  While “navigational” and “informational” patterns are high level & general information about the SAP solution, transactional action is more about the customer specific business data in the system. Joule can retrieve data about specific business data information.  Example: “Show prices for sales organization 1710 that are due to expire before December 31, 2025”.   Joule can even change data in the system.  Instead of going to a specific app to do an action, a user can write in their own works instruction for joule to change the data.  For example: “Extend the valid-to dates by one week” (Joule will know you refer to the previous question about sales prices).   In my opinion, these capabilities can be valuable but are pretty “light” in terms of AI.  SAP Business AI can also do much more sophisticated & generative transactional actions in the system, but those activities have much higher run costs and is part of Premium AI offerings for which customers must pay extra.

 

Check out more on the AI commercialization on PE Portal

Joule runs on SAP BTP.  To run Joule Base, a customer thus needs to have an SAP BTP account. If a customer does not have an BTP account, they will get the needed entitlements for free.  

What are my opportunities as reseller when Joule base is free? 

If Joule Base is free, there is nothing to resell, right?  So, what is in it for resellers?   The topic is much more strategic than this.  SAP’s channel partners don’t only “resell stuff”, they also take care of customers to ensure they get the most out of their SAP system, that customers are happy about their SAP system, order more services from the partner and keep renewing their SAP subscriptions (for which partner also get paid).  AI is probably the biggest technology trend at the moment, and I think it is great that channel partners can tell their customers that SAP has invested a lot in R&D to ensure their systems and investment stay up to date with technology.  My recommendation to resellers is to position Joule Base part of what they get for their subscription payments and something which helps protect their investment in their SAP system.  

As partner, you can obviously do services around advising and implementing Joule Base for the customer.   And there are a lot of opportunities to do additional AI work for customers on top of Joule Base, including reselling AI Units which are needed to activate the Joule Premium packages.  And partners can leverage Joule Base to trigger ideas at customers for customer specific AI capabilities, that you as partner can develop.

What does customers NOT get with Joule Base?

There are basically three categories of capabilities customers don’t get and must pay extra for if they want to use them:

  • Joule Premium PUPM packages..  There are many deep/niche AI embedded capabilities which is only available in via Joule Premium packages.  Examples are  Financial business insight for ERP Cloud, Performance Goal creation in SuccessFactors and E-mail draft recommender for Service Cloud V2.   These capabilities go much deeper than Joule transactional capabilities and consume significant more LLM capacity.  Thus, these are charged separately.  These functionalities are triggeed by users and thus included in the new Per User Per Month (PUPM) packages. 
  • Transactional Capabilities. There are some AI powered capabilities not triggered by users, but by “the system”.  These capabilities are therefore priced based on a transactional metering.  Example of this is "Document Grounding": the upfront indexing of customer specific documents so that they can be leveraged by users (free) via joule base informational pattern later.
  • Analytical Pattern: There is a fourth Joule pattern only available in Joule Premium packages, and that is “Analytical Pattern”; the capability for Joule to respond to user prompts about analytical analysis of their SAP data.  Note: customers also need to run SAP Analytic Cloud (SAC) for this to work.  In general, this pattern has been developed by the central Joule team, but most of the LOB product teams still need to make the connection between Joule, LOB solution and SAC. So this pattern is not available yet for most LOB solutions.

What does a customer need to do to get Joule base for free?

While it is free, Joule Base is not automatically available for all customers.  The reason is there are specific AI terms and conditions which SAP wants customers to sign before they get access to Joule.  “Old” customers don’t have these T&C's in their contract.  The easiest way for customers to get Joule Base is to “purchase ”Joule Base on the SAP store (at a cost of 0,00).   This will trigger the signing of the T&Cs and assignment of the entitlements in the customer’s system.

Can I as partner also get Joule Base for free for my TDD environment?

Yes.   For ERP Cloud, SuccessFactors, IBP and Digital Manufacturing, get it here for free for your LOB TDD system.  There is no TDD for ERP Cloud Private so there is also no Joule on TDD either.  However, this is planned to change in Q4 2025, so stay tuned.  For CX, Joule is not in GA yet but expected to come later this year, also for TDD.

If you are interested in more details, check out these documents: 

ERP Cloud

ERP Cloud Private

SuccessFactors

Customer Experience

entry.title: Copenhagen CSD Sept 24th - Discover Joule and Embedded AI Capabilities in SAP Ariba & Fieldglass
entry.content:
Are you ready to revolutionize your procurement processes and lead your organization into an era of intelligent, seamless operations?

If so, I warmly invite you to join my breakout session, “Joule and Embedded AI for SAP Ariba & SAP Fieldglass” at the upcoming Customer Success Day in Copenhagen this September 24th at 13:30 CEST.

As organizations navigate an ever-evolving procurement landscape, harnessing the latest in AI technology has never been more crucial. Whether you’re an SAP Ariba power user, a Fieldglass champion, or simply curious about the future of AI-driven procurement, this session is designed to inform, inspire, and equip you with practical tools you can put to work immediately.

Why to Attend This Session?

  • Stay Ahead of the Curve: Get the first look at Joule—the new SAP AI Copilot—and its skills for SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass.
  • Unified Experience Across SAP Solutions: Learn how Cloud Identity Services streamline authentication for your users, delivering a secure and harmonious login experience.
  • Unlock Embedded AI: See how AI capabilities are already working behind the scenes in SAP Ariba Category Management, Guided Sourcing, Guided Buying, and SAP Fieldglass.
  • Direct Access to Experts: Register for Customer Drop-in Sessions to dive deeper, ask questions, and get personalized support for your journey.

Who Should Attend?
If you are a procurement professional, IT leader, business analyst, or simply passionate about digital transformation, this session will bring you fresh insights and hands-on guidance. Come with your questions and your curiosity.

Let’s unlock what’s possible with AI for SAP Ariba and Fieldglass—see you in Copenhagen!

entry.title: AI-driven, Joule-enabled Warehouse Resource & Operations Management for SAP EWM on S/4 HANA 2023
entry.content:
It is a topic in every warehouse: Supervisors and Warehouse Operations Managers would like to see their planned workload for the day and see in real-time whether shipping times will be met. If shipping times are in jeopardy, the warehouse system is then expected to evaluate if an optimized resource allocation could pro-actively solve any potential delays. When a more optimal usage of the available resources is found, resources should automatically be directed to the critical areas. Being able to take action proactively is of the essence, because we do not want to only take action when we are already in delay.

The following is an example of an AI-driven, Joule enabled Application that can accomplish the above outlined requirements and activities supported by AI. The Application leverages the embedded AI in the EWM Private Cloud Edition S/4 HANA 2023 FPS03 release and the Joule Studio available in SAP Build.

 

 

The Architecture of the Application looks as follows:

 

AI-based Warehouse Workload Visibility

In the current version of the Application, the expected workloads of picking and packing operations are calculated leveraging the embedded AI capabilities in SAP EWM, which are then displayed in the UI5 Application (see in the example below):

It is also clearly visible in which Activity Area the workload is currently exceeding the planned Resource capacity.

The Application then further allows a manual simulation of adding or removing Resources to evaluate the impact in a given activity area. 

The fully "automatic rebalancing" function evaluates whether it is possible to optimize the resource allocation to the different areas, considering the allowed resource types in an Activity Area.

If an optimized resource allocation is possible, the warehouse operations manager, can accept these changes and the resources will be reassigned in the EWM system so that they will receive workload to execute from the new area.

Joule-enabled with custom EWM Joule Skills

Further more the current version of the Application provides Joule support for Warehouse Operations Management with the following Joule Skills:

- Joule Skill 1: Current Workload Analysis: Provide a comprehensive analysis of the current workload associated with picking and packing operations, considering the current resource allocation across different warehouse areas, as well as dependent scheduling of packing activities.
- Joule Skill 2: Provide Optimized Resource Allocation: Simulate an optimal workforce allocation strategy to mitigate bottlenecks and criticalities within the warehouse operations, to avoid shipping delays.
- Joule Skill 3: Accept Optimized Resource Allocation: Accept the optimization results and reassign the resources in EWM to the new areas.   

Coming soon an AI Agent will be introduce that autonomously orchestrates workforce allocation (monitored by the supervisor).

For more Information on this Application & AI functionality please contact SAP Services (EWMServices@sap.com).

entry.title: Joule for Developers with SAP BTP ABAP Environment-Setup Guide
entry.content:
Introduction:

On average, an SAP ABAP developer spends approximately 2 hours understanding the functional specification before beginning the coding process. Depending on the requirement, complexity, and the developer’s experience, he may take a day or two or more.

Over the years, every SAP customer has invested significant effort in custom developments, extensions, testing, and optimizing the code. Imagine if the developer is on vacation or has transitioned to a different project; in such cases, new code changes or updates become a considerable challenge for a new developer to manage.

From my years of SAP ABAP development experience, I have worked on several internal and customer requirements with few to many challenges understanding the code. With the introduction of AI in the current trend, SAP has been one of the front-runners in introducing AI capabilities. Let me take this opportunity to introduce you to SAP Joule for Developers (in short J4D).

“Joule” is the SAP copilot that ABAP developers need for their development tasks. It is uniquely trained on SAP data and processes. Joule's ABAP developer capabilities combine all the features to support full-stack development with ABAP Cloud. For instance, Joule provides real-time explanations of development objects, streamlining learning and finding answers to questions. Joule is fully integrated in the ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse and provides accurate information about currently opened development objects or marked lines of code. Joule is also able to predict and generate subsequent lines of code based on comments, or the code you're typing. The Joule code prediction takes the ABAP language version of your selected development object into account and suggests ABAP code that fits the respective language version context. Joule can generate ABAP cloud development scenarios, including all required development objects.

Why Joule for ABAP Developers:

The AI capabilities for ABAP are designed to enhance developer productivity by delivering new generative AI-powered assistance for frequent developer tasks. The ABAP AI capabilities utilize a purpose-built large language model (LLM) trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code to deliver the most precise, contextual results for ABAP workloads.

Benefits?

Joule can understand SAP development framework intricacies, anticipate developers’ needs, offer intelligent suggestions, and automate repetitive, mundane tasks like documentation and sample data generation. It can enable developers across pro-code and automation projects to be more productive, creative, and proficient in accelerating apps or extensions for business applications.

  • Predictive code completion based on context, comments, and project heuristics
  • Code explanations of core data services (CDS) view entities, classes, interfaces, and functional modules
  • AI-powered assistance for documentation, best practices, and new concepts
  • Boost developer productivity

Here is a glimpse of all the Joule for Developers(J4D) capabilities that it offers:

 

What license is required?

J4D is a part of SAP AI Unit (8019164), - the new Per User Per Month (PUPM) license model released by SAP for all requirements. However, we also have a limited offer with Joule for Developers (8019124) limited promotion, which is valid only until Q2 '2026. For more details on the limited option, please refer to the Blogpost and take a look at the SAP Note: 3571857.

Joule for developers ABAP AI capabilities is technically available in SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition after the upgrade to release 2502.

After purchasing the license:

  • SAP BTP ABAP Environment 
    All development tenants (where this license (8019164) is assigned/activated) in the corresponding SAP BTP Global Account are automatically enabled for the usage of Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities will show up only in one BTP Account where SKU is assigned.

Setup / Architecture diagram?

 

All requests to large language models are routed from ABAP to the AI foundation on SAP BTP. The use cases in the Accelerate category are managed by SAP. Once the subscription explained above is in place, the configuration part in your system is done automatically by SAP. Finally, update your ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse to the latest version using the link ADT version update to get the Joule integration in the IDE. Developers who shall be allowed to use Joule need the respective authorizations as explained in the documentation.

Use Cases: This documentation explains the ABAP development tools for Eclipse and refers to the range of functions that have been shipped as part of the standard delivery for the following products:

  • SAP BTP ABAP environment - If the user has ABAP SKU :8011136(Free), 8006181/8006182(Standard).  Use current blog steps to setup Joule for developers.                                                                                                                                                                                                           ABAP Service Plans-Service Plans and Metering for SAP BTP ABAP environment | SAP Help Portal, Know more-SAP Discovery Center Service - ABAP environment
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as of 2502- If the user doesn't have ABAP SKU as mentioned above, please use S/4 HANA PCE to setup Joule for Developers                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Setup Guide-Joule for Developer with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition-Setup Guide - SAP Community

Help doc: ABAP Development Tools 2502 GA Doc

Pre-requisite:

  • SAP BTP (Administrator role within subaccount)
    •  Joule Entitlements - please refer to license topic
      • ABAP environment-Standard
      • Cloud foundry
    • SAP Cloud Identity Services

Discovery center use cases (ABAP): SAP Discovery Center Business AI Features

Roles and Authorizations

To be able to use Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities, your system administrator must assign you to a business role that contains the business catalogue SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC.

Joule setup via SAP BTP (ABAP Environment).

Create a subaccount in your Global Account in SAP BTP.

 

 Enter a preferred Subaccount name, Select the region as per the Joule supported Data Centre and click on Create.

Help Doc (Data centers):

Entitlements

Under Entitlements: In this section, we add different service plans.

Add service plans: ABAP environment

Add multiple quantities of 1 ABAP_COMPUTE_UNIT, 2 HANA_COMPUTE_UNITS, 1 standard.

 

We are going to use Cloud Foundry for our Joule developer capability setup. To do so, navigate to your Overview page within your subaccount and click on Enable Cloud Foundry, as shown below:

 

Create a space where instances can be created and deployed with the required roles.

 

Know more about roles: About Roles in the Cloud Foundry Environment | SAP Help Portal

 

Security: Before Joule can assist your developers, trust and identity must be configured correctly. Here’s how to ensure your system knows who’s who and what they’re allowed to do.

Under the security, Maintain Trust Configuration:

Choose the SAP Cloud Identity tenant for users when logging on to applications in this subaccount.

In this screen, please validate if the Cloud Identity Service URL is using the domain model, “*.accounts.cloud.sap” or do you see “*.accounts.ondemand.com”, select the appropriate domain.

 

Choose domain:

 

Configure Parameters

Enter the mandatory details: Name, Origin key, Text for user logon.

 

 Help Docs: Configure Trusted Domains in Identity Authentication | SAP Help Portal,

                         Configure Trusted Domain in SAP BTP | SAP Help Portal

 

Instance creation:

Under the space, create an instance of ABAP Environment:

 

 Create a new instance: Enter your instance name

 

Then, provide the email address (Mandatory) and system description in the parameter section.

Given Joule for developers is only supported in development; without this step, the setup won't work.

 

Note: At this point, this will only work if the same user whose email ID was provided under the admin email tries this. This is because additional users in the system haven't been created.

The instance is created.

 Click on the instance, it will redirect to a URL:

Note: At this point, this will only work if the same user whose email ID was provided under the admin email tries this. This is because additional users in the system haven't been created

Copy the URL: https://********* abap-web.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/ - Here the region is EU, for your setup, the region can be different.

 

 Access Management:

Select Identity and access management from the dropdown:

Here, the User can add/delete the business roles.

 

 Add developer Role (SAP_BR_DEVELOPER) to the user: To access the ABAP developer functionalities.

Once, All the above steps have been incorporated, Goto ABAP Development Tool (latest version)

 

Create a new ABAP Cloud project:

 

Paste the URL Copied:

 Log on to the ABAP service instance:

 

 

Select the Default identity provider/ custom IDP created.

Help doc: How to setup a Customer IDP

After you log in: Success message will appear.

Your project is created.

 

Joule for developer’s capabilities.

AI-Based Feature

Description

More Information

Joule chat

The Joule chat supports you during the development process. Converse with the Joule chat in natural language, for instance, ask questions or obtain detailed explanations for code snippets or development objects.

For more information, see Chat.

Predictive Code Completion

The predictive code completion enables you to use AI-supported code completion in the ABAP source code editor.

For more information, see Predictive Code Completion.

Explain

The Explain feature enables you to get detailed explanations of selected development objects or lines of source code.

For more information, see Explain.

ABAP Unit

The AI-based ABAP Unit features are specifically designed to assist you in creating and improving your tests more effectively.

For more information, see ABAP Unit.

CDS Test Generation

The CDS test generation supports you in creating ABAP test classes for CDS entities.

For more information, see 

Generators

The Generators helps to boost your efficiency in generating unit test class for ABAP CDS entity.

For more information,

see Use CDS Test Class Generator | SAP Help Portal

Please look through the joule guide for more information: Joule Setup

Predictive Code Completion:

In the test class, create a new method like test_validate_customer_success (Positive scenario), try to create method test_validate_customer_failure (Negative scenario).

 

Press Enter: Application calculates predictive code.

Accept/discard.

 

 

 

 

In the search toolbar, search for joule:

 

 

 

 

 

In the joule pop up window:

Perform different operations:

 

Pretty printer the test class:

Joule lets the code modularize using pretty printer (Uppercase, Lowercase, spacing).

 

 

 Adding test cases

 

Joule helps to give some relevant test cases according to the code functionality.

 

 

FAQ’s: ABAP AI Strategy Frequently Asked Questions

Related Content:

Technical Announcement Blog: Joule speaks ABAP! - SAP Community

New landing page for SAP Joule for Developers: https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/joule-for-developers.html

Thank you and regards,

Yash

(AI consultant)

SAP AI RIG Team

entry.title: Joule for Developers with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition-Setup Guide
entry.content:
Introduction:

Typically, an SAP ABAP developer spends around two hours analyzing the functional specifications before diving into the actual coding. However, this time can vary significantly depending on the complexity of the requirement and the developer’s level of experience—ranging from a single day to several.

Over time, SAP customers have heavily invested in custom development, system enhancements, rigorous testing, and code optimization. This leads to a common challenge: when a developer goes on leave or transitions to another project, understanding and maintaining their code can become a daunting task for someone new.

Drawing from my own experience in SAP ABAP development, I’ve frequently encountered difficulties in interpreting legacy code—whether developed internally or for customers. In today's AI-driven landscape, SAP has taken bold steps to integrate artificial intelligence into its development ecosystem. One such innovation is SAP Joule for Developers (J4D).

Joule is more than just a digital assistant—it’s an AI copilot specifically designed to support ABAP developers. What sets Joule apart is that it's trained on SAP-specific data and processes, making it deeply contextual. It assists throughout the full-stack ABAP Cloud development lifecycle, offering features like real-time explanations of development objects, intuitive code insights, and instant answers to development-related queries.

Integrated directly into the ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse, Joule offers context-aware support for open development objects and selected lines of code. It also predicts and generates ABAP code in real-time based on your comments or what you’re typing. Importantly, it respects the language version of your development environment, ensuring that the suggestions align with the appropriate ABAP standards.

With Joule, developers can also generate complete ABAP Cloud development scenarios, including all necessary objects—significantly accelerating development and reducing the onboarding curve for new developers.

Why Joule for ABAP Developers:

The AI capabilities for ABAP are designed to enhance developer productivity by delivering new generative AI-powered assistance for frequent developer tasks. The ABAP AI capabilities utilize a purpose-built large language model (LLM) trained on 250 million lines of ABAP code to deliver the most precise, contextual results for ABAP workloads.

Benefits?

Joule can understand SAP development framework intricacies, anticipate developers’ needs, offer intelligent suggestions, and automate repetitive, mundane tasks like documentation and sample data generation. It can enable developers across pro-code and automation projects to be more productive, creative, and proficient in accelerating apps or extensions for business applications.

  • Predictive code completion based on context, comments, and project heuristics
  • Code explanations of core data services (CDS) view entities, classes, interfaces, and functional modules
  • AI-powered assistance for documentation, best practices, and new concepts
  • Boost developer productivity

 

  What license is required?

. However, we also have a limited offer with Joule for Developers (8019124) limited promotion, which is valid only until Q2 '2026. For more details on the limited option, please refer to the Blogpost and take a look at the SAP Note: 3571857.

After purchasing the license:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition -ABAP Environment 
    License (8019164) is assigned/activated, please be aware that it may take up to 24h after the process finished until all Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities are fully usable

Setup / Architecture diagram?

 

  • Joule is a software component, offered as Software-as-a-Service (managed, updated by SAP)​
  • Joule runs technically on the SAP Business Technology Platform​
  • A central, single “productive” tenant of Joule is recommended​
  • It can be instantiated multiple times, while a subaccount translates to a tenant. E.g. in case customers want to have a sandbox installation, or a separated dedicated Joule​
  • Respective tenants of SAP solutions (SAP SFSF, SAP S/4HANA Cloud) will then be “integrated” with a Joule tenant, manual process (“opt-in”)​
  • The Joule UI (Joule Web Client) appears then embedded within a frame within the connected SAP solution​
  • E.g. in case Joule is already set-up for SFSF the S4HANA system can simply be added to it!​
  • A central Joule tenant requires a “unified Identity and Access Management” (same IAS tenant for all connected SAP solutions)​
  • Current limitation: only 1 S/4HANA (Public/Private) tenant can be connected to a Joule tenant

 Finally, update your ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse to the latest version using the link ADT version update to get the Joule integration in the IDE. Developers who shall be allowed to use Joule need the respective authorizations as explained in the documentation.

Use Cases: This documentation explains the ABAP development tools for Eclipse and refers to the range of functions that have been shipped as part of the standard delivery for the following products:

  • SAP BTP ABAP environment - If the user has ABAP SKU :8011136(Free), 8006181/8006182(Standard).  Refer to Following blog steps to setup Joule for developers: Joule for Developers with SAP BTP ABAP Environment-Setup Guide - SAP Community            ABAP Service Plans-Service Plans and Metering for SAP BTP ABAP environment | SAP Help Portal, Know more-SAP Discovery Center Service - ABAP environment
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as of 2502- If the user doesn't have ABAP SKU as mentioned above, please refer to current S/4 HANA PCE Blog to setup Joule for Developers                     

Help doc: ABAP Development Tools 2502 GA Doc

 Pre-requisite:

Please follow the following process to enable Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities in the development instance(s):

  • Logon to SAP for Me.
  • Under Dashboards, please choose Services & Support.
  • On the tab Service Requests, choose the New Service Request button.
  • The system displays the New Service Request dialog. Choose the radio button Partner & Other Cloud Services.
  • On the service request home page, choose the Create Service Request button.
  • Search for "Toggle Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities" and then open the service request.
  • Use the service request to toggle the Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities and find the actual toggle status therein.

      Please be aware that it may take up to 24h after the process finished until all Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities are fully usable

        Discovery Center use cases (ABAP): SAP Discovery Center Business AI Features

Roles and Authorizations

To be able to use Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities, your system administrator must assign you to a business role that contains the business catalogue SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_AIQ_PC.

Joule setup via SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition:

Goto SAP For Me: me.sap.com

Under that go to System & Provisioning tab:

 

 Under public cloud systems:

Goto system with development system role and SAP S/4 HANA Cloud service:

 

click on instance, then click on launch URL:

 Your development system looks like:

Goto Identity and access management:

Maintain Business role:

Add SAP_BR_DEVELOPER Role to your user: To access the ABAP developer functionalities.

 

 

Copy the URL from the homepage:

 

Goto ABAP development tools (Latest version):

Click on create new project, Then Select ABAP Cloud Project:

Paste the URL copied from above:

 Log on to the ABAP service instance:

entry.title: ABAP AI Revolution Accelerates: The ABAP Developer Who Built Enterprise Apps in Minutes
entry.content:
The ABAP AI revolution just got a massive functionality upgrade and stays FREE OF CHARGE for another year

Remember John, our seasoned ABAP developer who discovered the power of Joule for AI-assisted coding? His journey has taken an incredible turn. What started as relief from "quick questions" and real-time assistance has evolved into something he never imagined possible – building entire applications and transforming legacy systems through conversation in minutes. 

John's incredible journey is about to accelerate even further with game-changing news: Joule for Developers remains FREE OF CHARGE for another year – the promotion has been extended with no commercial barriers, allowing every customer and partner to benefit from AI-driven development through material numbers 8019124 (customers) and 8019541 (TDD partners). This offer is now available not only for the BTP ABAP environments (Steampunk) and SAP Cloud ERP Public, but also to our SAP Cloud ERP Private customers using the latest 2025 release version. For a deep dive in more commercial details see ABAP AI - Chapter 2 blog written by my colleague @AlexanderRother 

See John's ABAP AI complete evolution with 2505, 2508 and 2025 ABAP releases:

  • The Game-Changer: ABAP Cloud Application Generation
  • Intelligent Business Logic with RAP Business Logic Prediction
  • Seamless Integration with OData Consumption
  • Enhanced Extensibility with Extensibility AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Public
  • The Migration Revolution: Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

 

The Game-Changer: ABAP Cloud Application Generation

John's latest project required a library application with multiple entities. Opening his package in ADT, he right-clicks and selects "Generate ABAP Repository Objects." The new OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard with Joule Chat appears.

"Create a library application with entities for branches, book stock, users and borrowing information. Generate the appropriate fields which fit the business case for the entities." John prompts.

Within seconds, Joule responds with a comprehensive proposal including all entities, fields, and relationships. One click on "Accept" and the wizard auto-populates all configuration fields. Minutes later, John has a complete, runnable RAP application with data model, behavior definitions, service bindings, and OData services ready for UI consumption.

Intelligent Business Logic with RAP Business Logic Prediction

But the magic doesn't stop at application generation. John's application needs sophisticated business logic – validations for booking dates, automatic stock calculations, and borrowing permission determinations.

Navigating to his behavior implementation class, John finds empty method stubs for his determinations and validations. The RAP Predict Business Logic capability kicks in, understanding the entity structure, field relationships, and business context to generate complete validation logic within the method implementation.

"It's not just generating code," John marvels. "It's understanding the business context and implementing proper RAP patterns automatically."

Seamless Integration with OData Consumption

When John needs to integrate with external booking services, he opens his service consumption model and starts the Joule chat with the /consume slash command. The OData consumption capability generates complete, ready-to-use ABAP code for consuming OData calls via the OData Client Proxy, tailored to his specific service model. 

What used to take hours of documentation reading now happens in seconds with Joule providing example prompts and OData request generation.

Enhanced Extensibility with Extensibility AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Public

As business requirements evolve, the Extensibility AI Assistant guides John through adding custom fields for regulatory compliance. It assists him in:

  • Creating Custom Fields for borrowing information
  • Finding Business Contexts for the right extension points
  • Enabling Usages where custom fields can be exposed in UIs, APIs, and analytical views
  • Enabling Business Scenarios for data flow between business objects
  • Finding Value Help Views for code list-based custom fields
  • Finding BAdIs based on natural language input

The Migration Revolution: Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 release, John faces his organization's biggest challenge: migrating 15 years of custom ECC code to SAP ERP Cloud Private 2025. The Custom Code Migration AI Assistant will transforms this experience (on October 2025 planned release).  These use cases are currently not available on the older releases, however the use cases delivered on 2025 versions will be soon provided also as part of the Custom Code Migration Application which is a standalone BTP ABAP environment (Steampunk) application which can connect freely to any ERP OnPrem or Cloud system to support RISE migrations. 

  • Using the Explain Capability: "Explain this legacy report," John types, selecting a 500-line ABAP program. The Explain capability provides detailed explanations of the ABAP program, breaking down complex concepts with support for ABAP classes, ABAP programs, and CDS artifacts. 
  • Explain ATC Findings Capability: When running ATC checks with S/4HANA readiness variants, John uses the Explain ATC Findings capability on his S/4HANA readiness findings. This capability provides detailed explanations and step by step resolution proposal on ATC findings from check variants for SAP S/4HANA Readiness, specifically for: S/4HANA: Field Length Extensions, S/4HANA: Search for Database Operations and S/4HANA: Search for Usages and Simplified Objects. Each finding links to simplification items, which Joule explains in detail.
  • Documentation Migration Assistance: Using the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant, John opens the Joule chat view,  type in /docs to start chatting about simplification items related to Custom Code Migration and ABAP SAP Help documentation.  To chat with the assistant about SAP S/4HANA simplification items and Custom Code Migration, just start asking topic-related questions. 
  • With Code proposal for code adaptation coming in SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS01, John will soon receive in addition of the step-by-step description of how to solve the ATC findings provided currently by ATC Explain functionality and a custom code adaptation automatically. 

The Complete ABAP Lifecycle Revolution

John's journey now encompasses the entire ABAP development and transformation lifecycle:

  • Build new cloud applications with OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard
  • Implement intelligent business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic
  • Integrate seamlessly with OData consumption
  • Extend dynamically with Extensibility AI Assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Public
  • Transform existing solutions with Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for RISE in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

John tells now to everyone: "Six months ago, I was struggling with syntax," John explains to his manager. "Today, I'm generating complete applications with the OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard, implementing business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic, consuming services with OData consumption, extending solutions with the Extensibility AI Assistant, and leading our S/4HANA migration with the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant – all through natural language conversations."

The impact is transformative:

  • Application Development: Dramatically faster with ABAP Cloud Application Generation
  • Business Logic Implementation: Massive reduction in development time
  • Migration Analysis: From weeks to hours using Custom Code Migration AI Assistant
  • OData Integration: Significantly less code required for side-by-side extension scenarios

 

The AI Revolution Accelerates – Chapter 2 Awaits! John's incredible transformation is just the beginning as we enter the next phase of ABAP AI evolution. Even more exciting, SAP is pioneering a revolutionary side-by-side ABAP AI service that will bring full AI capabilities to older SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition releases, enabling immediate access to new AI innovations without waiting for upgrades or support packages across hybrid landscapes. Get ready for TechEd 2025 where all the groundbreaking details of this hybrid AI service will be unveiled – the future of ABAP development is about to get even more transformative!

Ready to evolve your ABAP development approach? Check out the hands-on documentation in SAP Help and join the growing community redefining what's possible in enterprise development.

entry.title: 🚀 SAP BTP Weekly: seguridad reforzada, IA aplicada y nuevas alianzas estratégicas
entry.content:
Esta semana reunimos puntos que atraviesan las prioridades de CIOs que buscan control y eficiencia, arquitectos SAP que evalúan integraciones híbridas, equipos Basis preocupados por estabilidad y seguridad, y consultores que necesitan entregar valor más rápido. Verás novedades de IA práctica, avances en data & analytics, casos de automatización y reflexiones sobre cómo convertir complejidad en resultados tangibles.

 

SAP AI Core y modelos propios en BTP Las empresas ya pueden entrenar y desplegar sus propios modelos en SAP AI Core con integración nativa a datos SAP. Esto abre la puerta a IA especializada en cada industria, pero plantea un dilema: ¿cómo equilibrar innovación con compliance? Una aseguradora podría entrenar un modelo para detección de fraudes, pero ¿qué pasa si no logra explicabilidad suficiente? La promesa es grande, el riesgo también.

¿Tu organización está lista para invertir en IA propia o preferís modelos preentrenados de SAP y partners?

🔗Más información

Nuevo release de SAP Integration Suite La suite incorpora conectores preconfigurados para Salesforce, Workday y ServiceNow, simplificando arquitecturas híbridas. El beneficio es velocidad en despliegues, pero la realidad es que muchas empresas ya tienen middleware paralelo. Un retail puede ver valor en unificar todo en BTP, pero el costo de “migrar lo viejo” nunca es trivial.

¿Vale la pena consolidar integraciones en una sola plataforma o es mejor convivir con múltiples soluciones?

🔗Más información

DataSphere y federación en tiempo real SAP Datasphere suma capacidades para federar datos en vivo desde Snowflake y BigQuery, sin replicación masiva. Esto cambia el juego: menos ETL, más velocidad. Una minera podría consultar KPIs financieros y de producción en un único dashboard, pero la latencia y la calidad de metadatos pueden ser talón de Aquiles.

¿Creés que el futuro es federar datos en vivo o seguir apostando a replicar en un único repositorio?

🔗Más información

Joule for Developers: IA gratis hasta 2026 El programa permite a los desarrolladores usar capacidades de IA generativa dentro de SAP Build Code, Build Apps, Process Automation y entornos ABAP sin costo hasta septiembre de 2026. Esto acelera la creación de aplicaciones, automatiza procesos y mejora la productividad, pero también plantea un reto: ¿cómo asegurar que los equipos realmente adopten la herramienta y no quede como “demo eterna”? Imaginemos un equipo de manufactura que genera código para integrarse con sensores IoT en minutos, pero sin estrategia de adopción puede terminar en pilotos aislados sin impacto real.

¿En tu empresa ya están explorando Joule for Developers o aún se percibe como una prueba de laboratorio sin plan de escalamiento?

🔗Más información

Gestión de identidades con CIS: más allá del SSO SAP Cloud Identity Services ya no es solo un proveedor de inicio de sesión único: hoy permite aplicar MFA (autenticación multifactor), gestionar identidades externas y controlar accesos en entornos híbridos. El beneficio es claro: menos riesgos de seguridad y más trazabilidad. Pero el desafío aparece en la práctica: ¿quién define los roles y quién se hace responsable de revisarlos periódicamente? Una empresa de energía implementó MFA para usuarios críticos, pero descubrió que sin procesos de recertificación, la complejidad administrativa creció exponencialmente.

¿En tu organización la gestión de identidades es una práctica madura con roles y procesos claros, o sigue siendo una tarea reactiva que depende del equipo Basis?

🔗Más información

Sustainability Control Tower: visibilidad ESG en tiempo real La herramienta permite consolidar métricas ambientales, sociales y de gobernanza en un solo panel conectado a SAP y fuentes externas. El valor es dar a CFOs y responsables de sostenibilidad una visión clara para reportes y decisiones estratégicas. Integrada con BTP, gana aún más potencia: puede aprovechar conectores preconfigurados, flujos de datos en tiempo real y dashboards de analítica avanzada, evitando desarrollos ad-hoc y reduciendo el time-to-value. El reto está en la calidad y consistencia de los datos: una empresa de retail logró integrar emisiones de su cadena logística, pero descubrió que sin estandarizar la captura de datos de proveedores, los reportes perdían comparabilidad.

¿Tu empresa ya mide indicadores ESG de forma integrada con SAP o todavía depende de reportes manuales y dispersos?

🔗Más información

SAP Build Apps y citizen developers El nuevo release permite que usuarios de negocio creen apps móviles con integración directa a SAP S/4HANA. Esto democratiza la innovación, pero el riesgo es el shadow IT. Un equipo de logística puede crear su propia app de seguimiento, pero ¿qué pasa si no pasa controles de seguridad? El rol de IT pasa de desarrollador a “curador”.

¿En tu empresa los citizen developers son aliados estratégicos o una fuente de dolores de cabeza?

🔗Más información

Agenda: SAP TechEd 2025 – primeros anuncios SAP adelantó que la próxima edición de TechEd pondrá foco en IA generativa, clean core y analítica en tiempo real. Más allá de los keynotes, lo interesante es ver cómo los anuncios aterrizan en roadmaps concretos. CIOs esperan claridad de inversión, consultores buscan nuevas certificaciones y arquitectos quieren entender las integraciones que vienen.

¿Qué esperás con más interés: casos prácticos de IA, roadmap de S/4HANA o nuevas certificaciones de BTP?

🔗Más información

 

SAP BTP ofrece un valor único según el rol que lo mire. Para el CIO significa eficiencia, para el CFO transparencia y control financiero, para el arquitecto la posibilidad de diseñar integraciones más simples, para el Basis la tranquilidad de la estabilidad operativa y para el consultor la oportunidad de acelerar la entrega de valor. Sin embargo, más allá de esas perspectivas, todos enfrentamos la misma tensión: cómo lograr que la innovación se convierta en resultados tangibles sin perder el control en el proceso.

👉Te invito a sumarte al debate: ¿Cuál de estos 8 puntos sentís que impacta más en tu rol? ¿El verdadero freno a la innovación está en la tecnología, la cultura o la gobernanza?

La comunidad de BTP en LATAM se enriquece con las experiencias que compartimos entre todos.

entry.title: SAP AI Training und SAP AI Skills Self-Assessment
entry.content:
Es steht außer Frage: Der Aufbau von KI‑Kompetenzen ist heute entscheidend. Weil es so viele Möglichkeiten gibt, haben wir für Dich wichtige SAP KI Lernangebote kuratiert. Hier im Blog findest du:

  • Ein kurzes SAP AI Skills-Assessment - zur eigenen Einschätzung als erster Schritt
  • Kostenfreie Lernangebote nach Job-Rolle für KI-Beginner, Berater, Entwickler
  • Lernangebote zu embedded AI in SAP Lösungen 
  • Trainer-geführte Schulungen, in denen KI eine zentrale Rolle spielt 
  • AI Lernangebote mit dem SAP Learning Hub Abo wie Live Sessions und Übungssysteme zu KI
  • Zertifizierung(en) in KI

Komme gerne zurück auf diese Seite, denn da KI so dynamisch ist und so viel passiert, werden wir die Seite mindestens einmal pro Monat updaten. Nutze gerne den Subscribe button oben um Updates zu bekommen. Diese Seite ist eine Übersetzung und leichte Erweiterung der englischen "SAP AI Training" site.   

SAP AI Training nach Job-Rolle

hier gibt es u.a. folgende digitale kostenlose Lernangebote in englischer Sprache, weitere sind auf der Überblicksseite zu finden. 

Grundlagen

  • KI-Grundlagen | 3+ h - Einführung in KI-Grundlagen: Von Basiskonzepten bis Generative AI, SAPs Enterprise-Ansatz und verantwortungsvolle KI-Praktiken. 
  • Business-Transformation mit Joule Agents | 2+ h Joule Agents verstehen und nutzen: Entscheidungsfindung verbessern und KI-Funktionen integrieren. 
  • SAP Business AI entdecken | 40 Min - Wie SAP Business AI Geschäftswert schafft durch Prozessautomatisierung, bessere Entscheidungen und Innovation. 
  • KI-Ethik bei SAP | 1 h - SAPs KI-Ethikprinzipien, Governance-Framework und Regeln für verantwortungsvolle KI-Entwicklung und -Einsatz. (Ein sehr empfehlenswerter Kurs - s. auch hier ein Podcast zu KI-Ethik bei SAP).

Business User 

  • SAP Business AI für Finanzen entdecken | 3,5 h - SAPs KI-gestützte Finanzlösungen incl., wie SAP Business AI Finanzprozesse durch datengetriebene Erkenntnisse und optimierte Abläufe transformiert. 
  • Hochwertige Einsatzmöglichkeiten für Agentic AI identifizieren | 2 h - Intro zum Joule Agent Discovery Workshop, um wertvolle KI-Agent-Anwendungsfälle für dein Unternehmen zu identifizieren und zu priorisieren. 
  • Menschenzentrierter Ansatz zur Identifikation von Business AI Use Cases | 1 h 45 min - Lerne, wie du AI-Use-Case-Workshops durchführst und nimm an unserer Spot-the-Difference-Challenge teil, um Workshop-Materialien zu gewinnen. 

 Administrator

  • SAP Business Technology Platform erkunden | 4 h - Einführung in die SAP Business Technology Platform und die Intelligent Enterprise Strategie. 
  • SAP Process Orchestration kennenlernen | 4 h - Einführung in SAP Process Orchestration und die Advanced Adapter Engine Extended (AEX). 
  • Bereitstellung und Admin von Datenbanken in SAP HANA Cloud | 8 h - Bereitstellungs- und Administrationsaufgaben in SAP HANA Cloud durchführen.

Berater

  • Provisioning and Implementing Joule I 2h - Konfiguration und Integration von Joule, SAPs KI-Copilot, über verschiedene SAP-Plattformen hinweg zur Produktivitätssteigerung und technischen Optimierung. 
  • Fortgeschrittene KI-Techniken mit SAPs Generative AI Hub | 1 h 39  - Aufbauend auf KI-Grundlagen: Fortgeschrittene Techniken wie Data Masking, Content Filtering und Vector Embeddings im SAP Generative AI Hub anwenden.

  • Strategie und Skalierung von Business AI in der Praxis mit Patrick Kohler- Ein Podcast Interview mit Patrick Kohler, Head of Business AI Strategy & Advisory bei SAP, wobei es um Strategie und Einführung von SAP Business AI geht. 

  • Menschen-zentriertes Design von Business AI mit Beate Riefer vom SAP Apphaus - ein Podcast für Berater und Business User zur Einführung von SAP Business AI - siehe auch der Toolkit des SAP Apphaus mit Vorlagen u.a. für Joule Agent Discovery, AI Agent Design, Business AI Design, Business AI Exploration die bei jeder Einführung wichtig und hilfreich sind. 

Technische SAP KI Lernangebote 

Für Entwickler und technische Rollen empfehlen wir zudem folgende Lernangebote

  • Navigating Large Language Models fundamentals and techniques for your use case - 2h 47
  • Solving Your Business Problems Using Prompts and LLMs in SAP's Generative AI Hub - 5h 35  
  • Learning how to use the SAP AI Core service on SAP Business Technology Platform - 2h 42

Lernangebote zu Embedded AI 

SAP bietet bei Erstellung dieser Übersicht 295 AI Features und Agenten (aktuell immer hier im AI Katalog) - anbei eine Auswahl an Lernangeboten dazu

  • Introducing SAP Business AI for SAP Spend Management Solutions
  • Introducing SAP Business AI for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Introducing SAP Business AI for SAP SuccessFactors HCM
  • Discovering SAP Business AI Capabilities for SAP Finance
  • Introducing SAP Business AI for SAP Supply Chain Management

SAP Schulungen - Trainergeführt 

Trainergeführte Schulungen von SAP bieten ein Lernerlebnis das virtuell oder in SAP Schulungszentren stattfindet mit realen Anwendungsfällen, Zugang zu Übungssystemen geführt und geleitet von SAP Experten. In folgenden Schulungen spielt KI eine zentrale Rolle. Nach Auswahl des Landes findest Du konkrete Termine zum Buchen. 

  • SAP Business Technology Platform  - Erhalte eine Einführung in die SAP Business Technology Platform. 
  • Introduction to SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Administration - Lerne SAP BTP-Administrations-Grundlagen kennen, einschließlich Architektur, Tools, Sicherheitsmanagement und Anwendungslebenszyklus-Management in verschiedenen Laufzeitumgebungen. 
  • Introducing SAP Business Data Cloud - Einführung in SAP Business Data Cloud und die Data Engineering-Komponenten von SAP Business Data Cloud. 
  • Explore SAP SuccessFactors Solutions - Überblick über Funktionen und Features der SAP SuccessFactors Suite, verfügbar in verschiedenen Lernformaten und Bereitstellungsoptionen. 
  • SAP SuccessFactors Performance and Goals Academy - 15-tägiger virtueller Kurs zur Konfiguration von SAP SuccessFactors Goal Management und Performance Management, primär konzipiert für SAP-Partner-Berater mit Zertifizierungs- und  Bereitstellungsanforderungen. 
  • SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting: Recruiter Experience Academy - Lerne die SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting-Konfiguration, einschließlich Systemeinrichtung, XML-Anpassung und Geschäftsregeln, konzipiert für SAP-Partner-Berater mit Zertifizierungsanforderungen.

Wir planen auch eine unserer beliebten Schulungskonferenzen zu KI im ersten Quartal 2025. Bei Interesse schicke uns gerne eine mail und Du bekommst ein Update, sobald Infos dazu online sind. 

SAP AI Training im SAP Learning Hub

Mit einem SAP Learning Hub Abo gibt es viele zusätzliche "premium" Lernangebote wie Live-Sessions in 1-2 h durch Experten, Übungs-Systeme, Zertifizierungs-Gutscheine sowie Zertifizierungs-Updates, Learning Analytics und vieles mehr. Anbei ausgewählte KI Inhalte:

SAP AI Live-Sessions im SAP Learning Hub

  • Extend Joule Skills via Joule Studio in SAP Build | 45 minutes | 16-SEPT-2025 - Hands-on session on extending Joule with custom skills using Joule Studio in SAP Build, featuring live demos of creating and deploying tailored business automations.  (Recording).
  • Deep Dive into Joule Skills | 45 minutes | 23-SEPT-2025 - Hands-on session with Joule, SAP's AI Copilot, featuring live demos and practical guidance for driving efficiency and productivity in your organization. (Recording)
  • NEW: Embedded AI in Action: Top Use Cases You Can Activate Today I 1 hour I 15-Oct - 2025 - practical examples of how embedded AI and intelligent agents are integrated within SAP applications to automate, simulate, and optimize business processes, enabling users to quickly deploy AI-driven solutions for measurable business outcomes.
  • Optimizing AI Prompts for Business Tasks in SAP BTP using Generative AI Hub | 1 hour | 30-OCT-2025 - Live session on prompt management and optimization techniques for AI-driven business tasks using SAP Generative AI Hub in SAP BTP.
  • Implementing Real-World AI Models on SAP BTP | 1.5 hours | 11-NOV-2025 - Learn how to implement AI models on SAP BTP, with a focus on practical business use cases and deployment strategies.
  • SAP Business Technology Platform Pillars – AI Solutions | 2 hours | 11-NOV-2025 - Introduction to AI solutions in SAP BTP including embedded intelligence, machine learning services, and real-world business use cases.
  • Exploring the Latest Features of SAP BTP AI Services | 1 hour | 20-NOV-2025 - Learn about recent updates and new capabilities in SAP AI services available on SAP BTP, with a focus on new features and improvements. 

AI Übungssysteme im SAP Learning Hub

Es gibt bereits verschiedene Übungssysteme, in denen man verschiedene AI Features ausprobieren und damit experimentieren  und lernen kann. Das sind viele Systeme zu SuccessFactors oder SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). Interessant zu Wissen: In vielen Übungssystemen wie beispielsweise im IBP Umfeld ist Joule per „Standard“ inkludiert. Auch bietet unser Übungssystem-Team als „Early Adopter“ "AI-assisted planning" in Excel add-ins an. Anbei eine kurze Auswahl von Systemen:

  • S4C* (Sandbox) Joule activated/7 AI features activated
  • S4C LSC tenants Joule activated/7 AI features activated
  • S4D400/401/430 Joule (J4D: Joule for ABAP Developers) chat function on ADT
  • C4H62 AI scenario: Account Takeover Protection
  • S4TM2 AI scenario: Conversational Planning
  • IBP (all 17 courses for 2508) Joule activated in Practice Systems ohne dedizierte Übungen

SAP KI Zertifizierungen 

SAP Certified Associate - SAP Generative AI Developer ist derzeit die erste Zertifizierung, weitere folgen die nächsten Monate, was wir auch hier updaten. Diese Zertifizierung  bestätigt, dass du SAPs Business AI-Funktionen verstehst und über die Fähigkeiten verfügst, SAP BTP-Anwendungen zu erweitern, während du führende Large Language Models (LLMs) nutzt, unter Verwendung von SAP AI Core/SAP AI Launchpad und SAPs Generative AI Hub. 

Häufig gestellte Fragen (FAQ)

Was ist SAP Business AI?

SAP Business AI umfasst KI-Funktionen in SAP-Anwendungen und Plattformdiensten: Joule (KI-Copilot), eingebettete KI-Szenarien, Machine Learning auf SAP BTP und Entwicklungstools wie Joule Studio. Diese Technologien automatisieren Prozesse, liefern Datenerkenntnisse und steigern die Produktivität.

Für wen sind SAP AI Trainings geeignet?

  • Business/Key User: Für deine tägliche Arbeit mit KI-Tools
  • Administratoren: Für die Implementierung von KI-Lösungen
  • Berater: Für die Kundenberatung zu SAP-Lösungen
  • Entwickler: Für die Erweiterung von KI-Funktionen
Wir bieten Lernpfade für alle Kenntnisstufen.

Gibt es Voraussetzungen für SAP AI Trainings?

  • Einführungskurse: Grundkenntnisse von SAP-Lösungen
  • Entwickler-Kurse: Vorteilhaft sind Programmierkenntnisse wie Python
  • Fortgeschrittene Kurse: Teilweise Erfahrung mit SAP BTP erforderlich

Was kosten SAP AI Trainingsangebote?

  • Kostenlos: Selbstlernkurse, Webinare
  • Einzelkurse: Ab €640/Tag (Instructor-led)
  • SAP Learning Hub: €360 (Partner) und €1.260 (Kunden) jährlich

Wie lange dauert der Abschluss von SAP AI Lernpfaden?

  • Einführung: 10-15 Stunden
  • Rollenbasiert: 20-40 Stunden plus Übungen
  • Zertifizierung: 40-80 Stunden inkl. Prüfung
Die Kurse sind für berufsbegleitendes Lernen konzipiert.

Wie hilft mir SAP AI Training bei meiner Karriere?

Fachkräfte mit KI-Kompetenzen erzielen 14-28% höhere Gehälter. SAP AI-Expertise ist besonders wertvoll in der digitalen Transformation. Unsere Absolventen berichten von Beförderungen und Führungsrollen in KI-Projekten.

Wie starte ich mit SAP AI Training?

Beginne mit unserem kostenlosen Skills Assessment für persönliche Empfehlungen. Erkunde dann Einführungskurse oder Learning Journeys. Unsere Lernberater helfen dir gerne bei deinem individuellen Entwicklungsplan. Melde Dich gerne bei training.mee@sap.com bei Rückfragen.

entry.title: Feedback on Joule
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community Members,

 

Recently, we have deployed Joule in our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. We found the performance is disappointing. Although we have raised several support tickets to SAP OSS, it is very time consuming (We have found a lot of issues, including transactional capabilities, navigational capabilities, and informational capabilities when testing it), and it seems currently there is no official way for us to share our feedback about Joule. (We cannot find Joule on the Customer Influence Portal)

 

The following are the issues of Joule’s navigational capabilities. 

Note: I have added all standard roles in IAS and suppose it is not an authorization issue.

 

Issue 1: Cannot provide Navigation Link

Please see the following surprising conversation with Joule.

We ask “Fiori App to create PO”. Joule cannot provide the navigation link for such Fiori Apps.

When we ask “App to create PO”, Joule can provide the navigation link.

 

Issue 2: Does not support GUI transactions

We understand that navigational capabilities only support Fiori Apps. However, I hope SAP Joule will provide navigation capabilities for GUI transactions in the future. Otherwise, we will face the following issue.

We ask “App for Clearing Open Item Automatically”. Although no Fiori app is for F.13, it should not suggest F2223 (Reset Cleared Items)

It will only show the correct result if we ask for tcode.

Then we ask “App for Open MM Period” Joule will provide irrelevant Fiori apps. including F2293 (Open FI Period) and F4684 (Open CO Period) when no Fiori app is for opening MM period. 

 

If we ask the same question again, Joule will provide a weird query to us

 

We have tested a lot of Joule’s Base capabilities. Most users feel frustrated with its performance. My comment is “Joule is a product with unlimited potential. However, currently it is still at an early stage.” I believe Joule will perform much and much better when our feedback can reach the SAP Joule Product Team.

 

Thanks for your reading, 

Chak
